Description: 🇬🇷 Former Greek PM and PASOK leader Costas Simitis has passed away today.He served as prime minister from 1996 to 2004, overviewing modernisation programmes aimed to bring Greece into the Eurozone, which was achieved in 2002. Before that, he served in various ministerial positions, notably the Ministry of National Economy between 1985 and 1987, in which his austerity program caused dissatisfaction with the party majority, leading Papandreou to abolish it and fire Simitis.Under his premiership, annual inflation was brought down from 15% to about 3% and multiple infrastructure projects were constructed, even though most of them were delivered later than promised (Eleftherios Venizelos airport, Athens metro, Rio-Antirrio bridge). Nevertheless, Simitis is criticised for the handling of the Imia crisis in 1996, the Greek stock market crash of 1999 and for manipulating statistical numbers.📝 Kathimerini, Naftemporiki🗺 @PoliticsGR

Title: 🇺🇸 Two US Navy pilots were shot down Sunday over the Red Sea in...
